title: Spitsbergen
summary: Spitsbergen (Urban East Norwegian: [ˈspɪ̀tsˌbærɡn̩]; formerly known as West Spitsbergen; Norwegian: Vest Spitsbergen or Vestspitsbergen [ˈvɛ̂stˌspɪtsbærɡn̩], also sometimes spelled Spitzbergen)[2][3][4][5] is the largest and only permanently populated island of the Svalbard archipelago in northern Norway.
